body.header: Complete the letter by filling each gap with the correct word or phrase from the previous exercise.

p.font: Sorry I haven't been in touch for a while but I've been rather busy job hunting! Yes, I'm afraid I lost my fabulous job! I'm sure you remember how I boasted about the wonderful working conditions - the that meant I could work when I wanted to, and the wonderful of promotion! Well, I was made in March. I should have seen it coming really. The economic here led to a dramatic drop in sales, which affected the company's so badly that it almost went at the end of last year.

section.p: Then in February things started to look up as another company in the same field stepped in and a took place. When that happened, I thought I might just keep my job, but they decided that they didn't need such a big , and one of the first things they did was to the company and a lot of the work to consultants and other companies.

Anyway, since then I've been to at least twenty interviews but I'm getting nowhere. It's quite depressing actually because I've spent years getting the perfect together and it's looking really good now. I've got over fifteen years' experience in the marketing field, I've been on lots of courses and I've picked up quite a few along the way. I've also got some great from previous employers but it seems that the is just flooded with people like me.

p.font: What's more nobody wants to take on new staff in the present economic climate, at least not on full-time contracts. One company asked me if I was interested in - can you imagine that? Half the pay for probably just as much work! I'm seriously considering - I've got my own computer and an Internet connection and I quite fancy the idea of working from home for a change.
I'm afraid I haven't really got any other news for you - and I'd better get back to scouring the papers for job ads!
